bibl.title: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to James F. Presnell, July 24, 1900

div1.p: Stark reprimands Presnell for failing to properly handle a yellow fever outbreak at Pinar del Rio.

div1.head: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to James F. Presnell, July 24, 1900
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN
L.S. 307, Military file, L900.
CHIEF SURGEON'S OFFICE,
Hdqrs. Dept. Havana & Pinar del Rio
QUEMADOS, CUBA.
July 24th, 1900.
Act. Asst. Surgeon, James F. Presnell, U.S.A.,
Pinar del Rio Barracks, Cuba.
(Thro' Military Channels)
Sir:-
div1.p:
Being temporarilt in charge of the Chief Surgeon's
Office, I shall simply reprimand you for the course you have pursued in
the face of an epidemic of yellow fever that should have been apparent,
and shall have the Surgeon General deal with your case on its merits.

I find it impossible to comprehend the dense stupidity that
has actuated your course when the well known pathological lesions of
yellow fever were presented to you in addition to the perfect clinical
picture.

Nothing but the hand of Providence has saved the garrison
of Pinar del Rio Barracks from an awful fate.

You will accompany the First Infantry to New York from which
point you will hear from the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
A. N. Stark,
Captain & Asst. Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Acting Chief Surgeon.
